cards.name: Amnesia
cards.text: Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all nonland cards.
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand. Target player discards all non-land cards in his or her hand.
cards.flavor: "When one has witnessed the unspeakable, 'tis sometimes better to forget."Vervamon the Elder

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.name: Angry Mob
cards.text:
Trample

As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.
cards.originalText:
Trample

During your turn, the *s below are both equal to the total number of swamps all opponents control. During any other player's turn, * equals 0.

cards.name: Apprentice Wizard
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Ashes to Ashes
cards.text: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.
cards.originalText: Ashes to Ashes removes two target non-artifact creatures from the game and does 5 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."

—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If one of the targeted creatures is an illegal target by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it still exiles the other one and deals 5 damage to you.
If both of the targeted creatures are illegal targets by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it's countered. It doesn't deal 5 damage to you.

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.
cards.originalText:
Trample

Ball Lightning may attack on the turn during which it is summoned. Ball Lightning is buried at the end of the turn during which it is summoned.

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

foreignNames.name: ボール・ライトニング

printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Banshee
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Banshee deals half X damage, rounded down, to target creature or player, and half X damage, rounded up, to you.
cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Banshee does X damage—half (rounded up) to you and half (rounded down) to any one target.
cards.flavor: Some say Banshees are the hounds of Death, baying to herd their prey into the arms of their master.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time Banshee's ability resolves, the ability is countered. You won't be dealt damage.

cards.name: Barl's Cage
cards.text: {3}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.originalText: {3}: Target creature does not untap as normal during its controller's next untap phase.
cards.flavor: For a dozen years the Cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.

rulings.text: Does not prevent a creature from untapping at other times. It just stops the "normal" untap during the untap step.
You may target any creature with this ability. It doesn't have to be tapped.
If the targeted creature is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when the targeted creature is tapped.

Barl's Cage doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, this ability will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Blood Moon
cards.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
cards.originalText: All non-basic lands are now basic mountains.
cards.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.

rulings.text: Blood Moon's effect doesn't affect supertypes and won't turn any land into a basic land.
Nonbasic lands will lose any other land types and abilities they had. They will become Mountains and gain the ability "{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool."

If a nonbasic land has an ability that causes it to enter the battlefield tapped, that ability will still function. For example, if Blood Crypt is entering the battlefield, its controller may pay 2 life to have it enter untapped. Regardless of this choice, it will be only a Mountain and not a Swamp.

cards.name: Blood of the Martyr
cards.text: Until end of turn, if damage would be dealt to any creature, you may have that damage dealt to you instead.
cards.originalText: For the remainder of the turn, you may redirect damage done to any number of creatures to yourself instead.
cards.flavor: The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.

cards.name: Bog Rats
cards.text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.originalText: Cannot be blocked by walls.
cards.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

cards.name: Bone Flute
cards.text: {2}, {T}: All creatures get -1/-0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: All creatures get -1/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: After the Battle of Pitdown, Lady Ursnell fashioned the first such instrument out of Lord Ursnell's left leg.

rulings.text: The ability affects only creatures on the battlefield at the time it resolves. A creature that enters the battlefield later in the turn won't get -1/-0.

cards.name: Book of Rass
cards.text: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
cards.originalText: {2}: Pay 2 life to draw one card. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.

rulings.text: You can't spend yourself to below zero life. You can't spend life you don't have.

cards.name: Brainwash
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.originalText: Target creature may not attack unless its controller pays {3} in addition to any other costs required for the creature to attack.
cards.flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

rulings.text: This ability is paid for during the declare attackers step of the combat phase.
If there are multiple combat phases during the turn, the attack cost must be paid each time if you want to attack with the creature.
Paying this cost is not an instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.

cards.name: Brothers of Fire
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}{R} Brothers of Fire do 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.

cards.name: Carnivorous Plant
cards.text: Defender
cards.flavor: "It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Cave People
cards.text:
Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.

{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
If declared as an attacker, Cave People get +1/-2 until end of turn.

{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: City of Shadows
cards.text:
{T}, Exile a creature you control: Put a storage counter on City of Shadows.

{T}: Add {X} to your mana pool, where X is the number of storage counters on City of Shadows.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Sacrifice one of your creatures, but remove it from the game instead of placing it in your graveyard. Put a counter on City of Shadows. 

{T}: Add X colorless mana to your mana pool, where X is the number of counters on City of Shadows.

rulings.text: The storage counters aren't removed when you activate the mana ability.

You can activate City of Shadows's second ability while it has no storage counters on it, though it won't add any mana to your mana pool in this case. You've still tapped it for mana, though, in case any abilities (such as the ability of a Fertile Ground enchanting it) care about that.

cards.name: Cleansing
cards.text: For each land, destroy that land unless any player pays 1 life.
cards.originalText: All land is destroyed. Players may prevent Cleansing from destroying specific lands by paying 1 life for each land they wish to protect. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Coal Golem
cards.text: {3}, Sacrifice Coal Golem: Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {3}: Sacrifice Coal Golem to add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.
cards.flavor: "Three such creatures stood burning at the crest of the hill. Only seconds later, the Fireball struck our front line."Lydia, Countess Brellis

cards.name: Curse Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact

At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Curse Artifact deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she sacrifices that artifact.
cards.originalText: During his or her upkeep, controller of target artifact may choose to bury target artifact. If controller chooses not to bury target artifact, Curse Artifact does 2 damage to him or her.
cards.flavor: Voska feared the artifact had come too easily.

cards.name: Dance of Many
cards.text:
When Dance of Many enters the battlefield, put a token that's a copy of target nontoken creature onto the battlefield.

When Dance of Many leaves the battlefield, exile the token.

When the token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Dance of Many.

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dance of Many unless you pay {U}{U}.
cards.originalText: When Dance of Many is brought into play, choose a target summon card in play. Then put a token creature in play and treat it as if you have just brought an exact copy of target summon card into play. If Dance of Many leaves play, remove token creature from game. If token creature leaves play, destroy Dance of Many. If you do not pay {U}{U} during your upkeep, Dance of Many is destroyed.

rulings.text: Destroying the creature that was copied will not cause the token creature to be destroyed as well.
Each Dance of Many is associated only with its token creature. If one Dance leaves the battlefield, only the corresponding token is affected, not all tokens from all instances of Dance of Many.

The ability is targeted and checks the validity of the target when put on the stack and when resolving. If the creature is not still there when the copy ability resolves, the ability is countered and no token is put onto the battlefield. This card remains on the battlefield as an enchantment with no token.
The mana cost is copied.
Treat the token as entering the battlefield as a copy of the chosen creature. If that creature normally gets counters when entering the battlefield, the token creature gets counters.

If Dance of Many leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and put a token onto the battlefield. That token won't have any connection to a Dance of Many permanent, so it won't be exiled when a Dance of Many leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Dark Heart of the Wood
cards.text: Sacrifice a Forest: You gain 3 life.
cards.originalText:
You may sacrifice a forest to gain 3 life.

Counts as both a black card and a green card.
cards.flavor: Even the Goblins shun this haunted place, where the tree limbs twist in agony and the ground seems to scuttle under your feet.

cards.name: Dark Sphere
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Dark Sphere: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent half that damage, rounded down.
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice Dark Sphere to prevent half of the damage done to you by a single source, rounded down.
cards.flavor: "I was struck senseless for a moment, but revived when the strange curiosity I carried fell to the ground, screaming like a dying animal."Barl, Lord Ith

rulings.text: If two or more of these effects would apply, you apply them sequentially. So if the source would deal 5 damage after two of these abilities have resolved, the first one prevents 2 damage, reducing it to 3 damage, then the second one prevents a further 1 damage, reducing the total damage dealt to 2.

cards.name: Deep Water
cards.text: {U}: Until end of turn, if you tap a land you control for mana, it produces {U} instead of any other type.
cards.originalText: {U} All mana-producing lands you control provide {U} instead of their normal mana until end of turn.

rulings.text: Deep Waters affects lands you control when it resolves and any lands you gain control of this turn.
The amount of mana produced is unchanged, but it will all be {U}.

cards.name: Diabolic Machine
cards.text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
cards.originalText: {3}: Regenerates
cards.flavor: "The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

cards.name: Drowned
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drowned.
cards.originalText: {B} Regenerates
cards.flavor: We asked Captain Soll what became of the Serafina, but all he said was, "Ships that go down shouldn't come back up."

cards.name: Dust to Dust
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts.
cards.originalText: Removes two target artifacts from the game.
cards.flavor: Tervish never noticed that the amulet had vanished. It had disappeared not only from his possession, but from his memory as well.

rulings.text: If one target is removed or becomes invalid after declaration, the other target is still affected.

cards.name: Eater of the Dead
cards.text: {0}: If Eater of the Dead is tapped, exile target creature card from a graveyard and untap Eater of the Dead.
cards.originalText: o0: Take one creature from any graveyard and remove it from the game. Untap Eater of the Dead.
cards.flavor: Even the putrid muscles of the dead can provide strength to those loathsome enough to consume them.

rulings.text: It untaps during the resolution of its ability.
You can activate the ability whether or not Eater of the Dead is tapped. However, if Eater of the Dead is untapped when the ability resolves, the ability won't do anything.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

cards.name: Electric Eel
cards.text:
When Electric Eel enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to you.

{R}{R}: Electric Eel gets +2/+0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText: {R}{R} +2/+0; Electric Eel does 1 damage to you. Electric Eel does 1 damage to you when it is brought into play.

cards.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
cards.text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool, and Elves of Deep Shadow do 1 damage to you. This ability is played as an interrupt.
cards.flavor: "They are aberrations who have turned on everything we hold sacred. Let them be cast out."Ailheen, Speaker of the Council

cards.name: Erosion
cards.text:
Enchant land

At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, destroy that land unless that player pays {1} or 1 life.
cards.originalText: Target land is destroyed unless its controller pays {1} or pays 1 life during his or her upkeep. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Eternal Flame
cards.text: Eternal Flame deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of Mountains you control. It deals half X damage, rounded up, to you.
cards.originalText: Eternal Flame does an amount of damage to your opponent equal to the number of mountains you control, but it also does half that amount of damage to you, rounding up.

cards.name: Exorcist
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black creature.
cards.originalText: {1}{W}, {T}: Target black creature is destroyed.
cards.flavor: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.

cards.name: Fasting
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a hunger counter on Fasting. Then destroy Fasting if it has five or more hunger counters on it.

If you would begin your draw step, you may skip that step instead. If you do, you gain 2 life.

When you draw a card, destroy Fasting.
cards.originalText: You may choose to skip your draw phase; if you do so, you gain 2 life. If you draw a card for any reason, Fasting is destroyed. During your upkeep, put a hunger counter on Fasting. When Fasting has five hunger counters on it, it is destroyed.

rulings.text: When you resolve the beginning-of-upkeep triggered ability, you first put a hunger counter on Fasting, then you check how many hunger counters it has. If there are five or more, Fasting is destroyed.
You choose whether or not to skip your draw step as that step begins. This ability is now separate from the beginning-of-upkeep triggered ability.

cards.name: Fellwar Stone
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add 1 mana to your mana pool. This mana may be of any color that any of opponent's lands can produce. This ability is played as an interrupt.
cards.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"

—Mairsil, called the Pretender

rulings.text: It only produces one mana even if the land can produce more than one.
This works even if the opponent's lands are tapped. It only checks what kinds of mana can be produced, not if the abilities that produce them are usable right now.
The ability can be activated if the opponent has no lands that produce mana, but the effect will not be able to generate any mana.
The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Fellwar Stone can't be tapped for colorless mana, even if a land an opponent controls could produce colorless mana.

Fellwar Stone checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands your opponents control, but it doesn't check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool." If an opponent controls Vivid Crag and you control Fellwar Stone, you can tap Fellwar Stone for any color of mana. It doesn't matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn't matter whether it's untapped.

When determining what colors of mana your opponents' lands could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to those lands' mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.

Fellwar Stone doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your opponents' lands (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) put on the mana they produce. It just cares about colors of mana.

cards.name: Festival
cards.text:
Cast Festival only during an opponent's upkeep.

Creatures can't attack this turn.
cards.originalText: Opponent may not declare an attack this turn. Play during opponent's upkeep phase.
cards.flavor: Only after the townsfolk had drawn us into their merry celebration did we discover that their holiday rituals held a deeper purpose.

cards.name: Fire and Brimstone
cards.text: Fire and Brimstone deals 4 damage to target player who declared an attacking creature this turn and 4 damage to you.
cards.originalText: Fire and Brimstone does 4 damage to target player and 4 damage to you. Can only be used during a turn in which target player has declared an attack.

cards.name: Fire Drake
cards.text:
Flying

{R}: Fire Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying

{R} +1/+0 until end of turn. No more than {R} may be spent in this way each turn.

cards.name: Fissure
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Target land or creature is buried.
cards.flavor: "Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?"Plato

cards.name: Flood
cards.text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
cards.originalText: {U}{U} Target non-flying creature becomes tapped.
cards.flavor:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."

—Vibekke Ragnild, Witches and War

cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The Fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.

cards.name: Frankenstein's Monster
cards.text: As Frankenstein's Monster enters the battlefield, exile X creature cards from your graveyard. If you can't, put Frankenstein's Monster into its owner's graveyard instead of onto the battlefield. For each creature card exiled this way, Frankenstein's Monster enters the battlefield with a +2/+0, +1/+1, or +0/+2 counter on it.
cards.originalText: When Frankenstein's Monster is brought into play, if you do not take X creatures from your graveyard and remove them from the game, Frankenstein's Monster is countered. For each creature removed from your graveyard in this way, you may choose to give Frankenstein's Monster a permanent +2/+0, +1/+1, or +0/+2.

rulings.text: X can be any number and it does not have to match the total contents of your graveyard.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

cards.name: Gaea's Touch
cards.text:
{0}: You may put a basic Forest card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.

Sacrifice Gaea's Touch: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: You may put one additional land in play during each of your turns, but that land must be a basic forest. You may sacrifice Gaea's Touch to add {G}{G} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

rulings.text: The land enters the battlefield directly from your hand, but it is not "played". This means it does not count towards the number of lands played this turn and doesn't trigger abilities that would trigger if the Forest had been played.

cards.name: Ghost Ship
cards.text:
Flying

{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.
cards.originalText: Flying, {U}{U}{U} Regenerates
cards.flavor: "That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below."Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad

cards.name: Giant Shark
cards.text:
Giant Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

Whenever Giant Shark blocks or becomes blocked by a creature that has been dealt damage this turn, Giant Shark gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice Giant Shark.
cards.originalText: If Giant Shark blocks or is blocked by a creature that has taken damage this turn, Giant Shark gains +2/+0 and trample until end of turn. Giant Shark cannot attack unless opponent controls at least one island. Giant Shark is buried immediately if at any time controller controls no islands.

rulings.text: Giant Shark only gains its bonus if the blocking creature was damaged before blocking was declared. Damaging the creature later will not give the Shark the bonus.
The bonus happens when a previously damaged creature becomes a blocker and the bonus is not removed if that creature is removed from the blocking situation by any means.
If a creature enters a blocking situation with the Giant Shark due to being part of a banded group of attackers, the Shark will get the bonus if that creature is damaged at that time.
Giant Shark gets the bonus once for each creature it blocks or is blocked by that meets the criteria.

cards.name: Goblin Caves
cards.text:
Enchant land

As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +0/+2.
cards.originalText: If target land is a basic mountain, all Goblins gain +0/+2.
cards.flavor: The stench of countless generations of unspeakable activities was enough to loosen both our footing and our stomachs.

rulings.text: Works even if placed on one of your opponent's Mountains.
Works if enchanting a Snow-Covered Mountain.

cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team to destroy target wall.
cards.flavor: "From down here we can make the whole wall collapse" "Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavor: They attack in an orgy of rage and madness, but only one seemed as focused on killing us as the sheer joy of battle.

cards.name: Goblin Rock Sled
cards.text:
Trample

Goblin Rock Sled doesn't untap during your untap step if it attacked during your last turn.

Goblin Rock Sled can't attack unless defending player controls a Mountain.
cards.originalText:
Trample

Rock Sled may not attack unless opponent controls at least one mountain. Rock Sled does not untap as normal during your untap phase if it attacked during your last turn.

cards.name: Goblin Shrine
cards.text:
Enchant land

As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +1/+0.

When Goblin Shrine leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each Goblin creature.
cards.originalText: If target land is a basic mountain, all Goblins gain +1/0. Goblin Shrine does 1 damage to all Goblins if it leaves play.
cards.flavor: "I knew it weren't no ordinary pile of—you know."Norin the Wary

rulings.text: Works even if placed on one of your opponent's Mountains.

cards.name: Goblin Wizard
cards.text:
{T}: You may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.

{R}: Target Goblin gains protection from white until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Take a Goblin from your hand and put it directly into play. Treat this goblin as if it were just summoned.

{R} Target Goblin gains protection from white until end of turn.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.name: Goblins of the Flarg
cards.text:
Mountainwalk

When you control a Dwarf, sacrifice Goblins of the Flarg.
cards.originalText:
Mountainwalk

Goblins of the Flarg are buried if controller controls any Dwarves.

cards.name: Grave Robbers
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.
cards.originalText: {B}, {T}: Take one artifact from any graveyard and remove it from the game. Gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "If you don't have your health, you don't have anything."Proverb

rulings.text: If the target is not there on resolution, you do not gain the life.
This exiles the artifact on resolution, but you choose it as a target when activating the ability.

cards.name: Hidden Path
cards.text: Green creatures have forestwalk.
cards.originalText: All green creatures gain forestwalk.
cards.flavor: "Where moments before we were lost beyond hope, the strange, floating lights showed us the way and restored our morale."Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Holy Light
cards.text: Nonwhite creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: All non-white creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired."The Book of Tal

cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.originalText: Inferno does 6 damage to all players and all creatures.
cards.flavor: "Any scrap of compassion that still existed in my soul was permanently snuffed out when they cast me out into the flames."Mairsil, called the Pretender

cards.name: Inquisition
cards.text: Target player reveals his or her hand. Inquisition deals damage to that player equal to the number of white cards in his or her hand.
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand. Inquisition does 1 damage to target player for each white card in his or her hand.
cards.flavor: Many of those entrusted to Primata Delphine's care tended to express themselves with screams.

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.name: Knights of Thorn
cards.text: Protection from red; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: Protection from red, banding
cards.flavor: "With a great cry, the Goblin host broke and ran as the first wave of Knights penetrated its ranks."Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.name: Land Leeches
cards.text: First strike
cards.originalText: First strike
cards.flavor: "The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample

Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.

Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
cards.originalText:
Trample

Leviathan comes into play tapped, and does not untap as normal during your untap phase.

Sacrifice two islands during your upkeep phase to untap Leviathan.

Leviathan may not attack unless you sacrifice two islands during your attack.

rulings.text: You don't have to pay the untap cost if it is untapped outside the upkeep phase or is untapped by an effect.

cards.name: Living Armor
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Living Armor: Put X +0/+1 counters on target creature, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice Living Armor to put a +0/+X counter on target creature, where X is target creature's casting cost.
cards.flavor: Though it affords excellent protection, few don this armor. The process is uncomfortable and not easily reversed.

cards.name: Lurker
cards.text: Lurker can't be the target of spells unless it attacked or blocked this turn.
cards.originalText: Lurker may not be the target of any spell unless Lurker was declared as an attacker or blocker this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Each night we felt it watching us from the darkness beyond our fire. We only had one pack horse left."

—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.
cards.originalText: You and target player each flip a coin. Mana Clash does 1 damage to any player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads at the same time.

rulings.text: Always affects the player and targets one of his or her opponents.
Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

cards.name: Mana Vortex
cards.text:
When you cast Mana Vortex, counter it unless you sacrifice a land.

At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a land.

When there are no lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Mana Vortex.
cards.originalText: Each player who controls land sacrifices one land during his or her upkeep. If at any time there are no lands in play, Mana Vortex is destroyed. If you do not sacrifice a land when Mana Vortex is cast, Mana Vortex is countered.

rulings.text: When you cast Mana Vortex, its first ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of the Mana Vortex spell. The triggered ability resolves first. When it resolves, you either sacrifice a land or you counter Mana Vortex.

Mana Vortex's third ability is a "state trigger." Once a state trigger triggers, it won't trigger again as long as the ability is on the stack. If the ability is countered and the trigger condition is still true, it will immediately trigger again.

cards.name: Marsh Gas
cards.text: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."Keevy Bogsbury

cards.name: Marsh Goblins
cards.text: Swampwalk
cards.originalText:
Swampwalk

Counts as both a black card and a red card.
cards.flavor: Even the other Goblin races shun the Marsh Goblins, thanks to certain unwholesome customs they practice.

cards.name: Marsh Viper
cards.text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
cards.originalText: If Marsh Viper damages opponent, opponent gets two poison counters. If opponent ever has ten or more poison counters, opponent loses game.
cards.flavor:
"All we had left were their black and bloated bodies."Maeveen

O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

cards.name: Martyr's Cry
cards.text: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.
cards.originalText: All white creatures are removed from the game. Players must draw one card for each white creature they control that is lost in this manner.
cards.flavor: "It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge."Vervamon the Elder

rulings.text: Only affects creatures on the battlefield, not ones in hands or graveyards.

cards.name: Maze of Ith
cards.text: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target attacking creature becomes untapped. This creature neither deals nor receives damage as a result of combat.

rulings.text: Can target an untapped attacking creature. Both parts of the effect will try to happen even if one part does nothing useful. So if it tries to untap an already untapped card, it will still make the creature neither deal nor receive damage.
The creature is still part of the combat. It just has its damage prevented. Don't infer something from the fact that it becomes untapped.

cards.name: Merfolk Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target creature with islandwalk.
cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target creature that has islandwalk.

rulings.text: Can target a creature with snow islandwalk.

foreignNames.name: マーフォークの暗殺者

cards.name: Mind Bomb
cards.text: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards he or she discarded this way.
cards.originalText: Mind Bomb does 3 damage to each player. All players may discard up to three cards of their choice from their hands. Each card a player discards in this manner prevents 1 damage to that player from Mind Bomb.

cards.name: Miracle Worker
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature you control.
cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target enchantment card on a creature you control.
cards.flavor: "Those blessed hands could bring surcease to even the most tainted soul."Sister Betje, Miracles of the Saints

cards.name: Morale
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: All attacking creatures gain +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan."Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

cards.name: Murk Dwellers
cards.text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.
cards.originalText: When attacking, Murk Dwellers gain +2/+0 if not blocked.
cards.flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.name: Nameless Race
cards.text:
Trample

As Nameless Race enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life. The amount you pay can't be more than the total number of white nontoken permanents your opponents control plus the total number of white cards in their graveyards.

Nameless Race's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Trample

Pay * life when bringing Nameless Race into play. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life. When Nameless Race is brought into play, * may not be greater than the total number of white cards all opponents have in play and in their graveyards.

rulings.text: If put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability, you pay life during the resolution of that spell or ability.
The life payment is made just as the card is being put onto the battlefield.
This currently has no creature type.  It's Nameless.

cards.name: Necropolis
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)

Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put X +0/+1 counters on Necropolis, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.
cards.originalText:
Counts as a wall.

o0: Take a creature in your graveyard and remove it from the game. Put X +0/+1 counters on Necropolis, where X is the removed creature's casting cost.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

cards.name: Niall Silvain
cards.text: {G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.
cards.originalText: {G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Target creature is regenerated.
cards.flavor: This is his domain, and while you remain here you must value all life as you value your own.

cards.name: Orc General
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice one Orc or Goblin to give all Orcs +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph."Malga Phlegmtooth

cards.name: People of the Woods
cards.text: People of the Woods's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
cards.originalText: The * below represents the number of forests controlled by People of the Woods' controller.
cards.flavor: "Their rain of arrows left only myself alive, cowering within a tree hollow. They did not even come out to loot the bodies."Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Pikemen
cards.text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: Banding, first strike
cards.flavor: "As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. ‘Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.name: Preacher
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Preacher during your untap step.

{T}: For as long as Preacher remains tapped, gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice he or she controls.
cards.originalText: {T}: Gain control of one of opponent's creatures. Opponent chooses which target creature you control. If Preacher becomes untapped, you lose control of this creature; you may choose not to untap Preacher as normal during your untap phase. You also lose control of the creature if Preacher leaves play or at end of game.

rulings.text: The target of the ability is a creature the chosen opponent controls. As the ability resolves, if the target isn't a creature controlled by the chosen opponent, the ability will be countered. If the ability's target is changed somehow, the new target must be a creature controlled by the chosen opponent.

Whether Preacher is tapped is checked continually, starting when the ability is activated. If, before the ability resolves, there's any point at which Preacher is untapped, the ability has no effect -- even if Preacher is tapped again by the time the ability resolves.
When you activate the ability, you choose an opponent, then that opponent chooses the target.

cards.name: Psychic Allergy
cards.text:
As Psychic Allergy enters the battlefield, choose a color.

At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Psychic Allergy deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of nontoken permanents of the chosen color he or she controls.

At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Psychic Allergy unless you sacrifice two Islands.
cards.originalText: Choose a color when casting Psychic Allergy. During opponent's upkeep, Psychic Allergy does 1 damage to opponent for each card of this color that he or she controls. Sacrifice two islands during your upkeep or Psychic Allergy is destroyed.

cards.name: Rag Man
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.originalText:
{B}{B}{B}, {T}: Look at opponent's hand.

If opponent has any creature cards in hand, he or she discards one of them at random. This ability can only be used during controller's turn.
cards.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

cards.name: Reflecting Mirror
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Change the target of target spell with a single target if that target is you. The new target must be a player. X is twice the converted mana cost of that spell.
cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Target spell, which targets you, targets the player of your choice instead. X is twice the casting cost of target spell. This ability is played as an interrupt.

rulings.text: Can't be used on abilities of permanents. Those are abilities and not spells.
This spell only changes the target of a spell, and not the player.
This can't be used on spells which affect "you" and which do not say they target you.

cards.name: Riptide
cards.text: Tap all blue creatures.
cards.originalText: All blue creatures become tapped.

cards.name: Runesword
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Runesword. If the creature deals damage to a creature this turn, the creature dealt damage can't be regenerated this turn. If a creature dealt damage by the targeted creature would die this turn, exile that creature instead.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target attacking creature gains +2/+0 until end of turn. Any creature damaged by target creature may not be regenerated this turn; if such a creature is placed in the graveyard this turn, remove it from the game. If target creature leaves play before end of turn, Runesword is buried.

cards.name: Safe Haven
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Safe Haven. If you do, return each card exiled with Safe Haven to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Remove target creature you control from game. This ability is played as an interrupt.

During your upkeep, sacrifice Safe Haven to return all creatures it has removed from game directly into play. Treat this as if they were just summoned.

rulings.text: When creatures return to the battlefield, they are put onto the battlefield as if just cast. Creatures with X in the mana cost are treated as X is zero. Creatures which can pay costs when put onto the battlefield to determine abilities must have those costs paid at this time.
Token creatures cease to exist when they leave the battlefield, so this effect just exiles them with no chance to bring them back like you can with cards.
If changed to another land type, the creature cards are not lost but can't be released until the land reverts to normal.
When the creature leaves the battlefield any damage or "will be destroyed at some future time" effects are removed from the creature.
Auras on creatures are put into the graveyard and counters on creatures are removed when the creatures are sent to the Haven.
Creatures return to the control of their owners, regardless of who controls the Haven when it is sacrificed.
All cards in the Haven stay there even if they cease to be creatures. When the Haven is sacrificed, the cards come back onto the battlefield whether or not they are creatures.
Creatures return to the battlefield simultaneously.

cards.name: Savaen Elves
cards.text: {G}{G}, {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a land.
cards.originalText: {G}{G}, {T}: Target enchant land is destroyed.
cards.flavor: "Purity of magic can only come from purity of the land. How can a meal nourish if the ingredients are spoiled?Sidaine of Savaen

cards.name: Scarecrow
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by creatures with flying.
cards.originalText: {6}, {T}: Until end of turn, all damage done to you by flying creatures is reduced to 0.
cards.flavor: There was more malice in its button eyes than should have been possible in something that had never known life.

rulings.text: Even prevents non-combat damage from flying creatures.

cards.name: Scarwood Bandits
cards.text:
Forestwalk

{2}{G}, {T}: Unless an opponent pays {2}, gain control of target artifact for as long as Scarwood Bandits remains on the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Forestwalk

{2}{G}, {T}: Take control of target artifact. Opponent may counter this action by paying {2}. You lose control of target artifact if Scarwood Bandits leave play or at end of game.

cards.name: Scarwood Goblins
cards.originalText: Counts as both a green card and a red card.
cards.flavor: Larger and more cunning than most Goblins, Scarwood Goblins are thankfully found only in isolated pockets.

cards.name: Scarwood Hag
cards.text:
{G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.

{T}: Target creature loses forestwalk until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.

{T}: Target creature loses forestwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Sacrifice Scavenger Folk to destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: String, weapons, wax, or jewels—it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.

cards.name: Season of the Witch
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Season of the Witch unless you pay 2 life.

At the beginning of the end step, destroy all untapped creatures that didn't attack this turn, except for creatures that couldn't attack.
cards.originalText: At the end of each player's turn, all of his or her untapped creatures that could have attacked but did not are destroyed. If you do not pay 2 life during your upkeep, Season of the Witch is destroyed. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.

rulings.text: At the beginning of every end step, regardless of whose turn it is, the second ability triggers. When it resolves every creature that could have been declared as an attacker during that turn's Declare Attackers Step but wasn't will be destroyed.

A creature won't be destroyed if it was unable to attack that turn, even if you had a way to enable it to attack. For example, a creature that had summoning sickness wouldn't be destroyed even if you had a way to give it haste.

cards.name: Sisters of the Flame
cards.text: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.
cards.flavor: We are many wicks sharing a common tallow; we feed the skies with the ashes of our prey.

cards.name: Skull of Orm
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Bring one enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Though lifeless, the Skull still possessed a strange power over the flow of magic.

rulings.text: Can bring back any enchantment.

cards.name: Sorrow's Path
cards.text:
{T}: Choose two target blocking creatures an opponent controls. If each of those creatures could block all creatures that the other is blocking, remove both of them from combat. Each one then blocks all creatures the other was blocking.

Whenever Sorrow's Path becomes tapped, it deals 2 damage to you and each creature you control.
cards.originalText: {T}: Exchange two of opponent's blocking creatures. This exchange may not cause an illegal block. Sorrow's Path does 2 damage to you and 2 damage to each creature you control whenever it is tapped.

rulings.text: This has two abilities. The second ability triggers any time it becomes tapped, whether to pay for its ability or not.

The first ability can target any two blocking creatures a single opponent controls. Whether those creatures could block all creatures the other is blocking isn't determined until the ability resolves.

A "blocking creature" is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures that it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat by then.

When Sorrow's Path's first ability is activated, its second ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of the first ability. The second ability resolves first, and may cause some of the attacking creatures to be dealt lethal damage.

When determining whether a creature could block all creatures the other is blocking, take into account evasion abilities (like flying), protection abilities, and other blocking restrictions, as well as abilities that allow a creature to block multiple creatures or block as though a certain condition were true. Take into account whether those creatures are tapped, but not whether they have costs to block (since those apply only as blockers are declared).

When the first ability resolves, if all the creatures that one of the targeted creatures was blocking have left combat, then the other targeted creature is considered to be able to block all creatures the first creature is blocking. If the ability has its full effect, the second creature will be removed from combat but not returned to combat; it doesn't block anything.

Abilities that trigger whenever one of the targeted creatures blocks will trigger when the first ability resolves, because those creatures will change from not blocking (since they're removed from combat) to blocking. It doesn't matter if those abilities triggered when those creatures blocked the first time. Abilities that trigger whenever one of the attacking creatures becomes blocked will not trigger again, because they never stopped being blocked creatures. Abilities that trigger whenever a creature blocks one of the attacking creatures will trigger again, though; those kinds of abilities trigger once for each creature that blocks.

cards.name: Spitting Slug
cards.text: Whenever Spitting Slug blocks or becomes blocked, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn. Otherwise, each creature blocking or blocked by Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {1}{G} Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn. If this ability is not activated, all creatures blocking or blocked by Spitting Slug gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Squire
cards.flavor: "Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse. Of his stature he was of even lengthe. And wonderly deliver, and greete of strengthe."Geoffrey Chaucer, The Canterbury Tales

cards.name: Standing Stones
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Pay 1 life and add 1 mana of any color to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Stone Calendar
cards.text: Spells you cast cost up to {1} less to cast.
cards.originalText: Your spells cost up to 1 less to cast; casting cost of spells cannot go below 0.
cards.flavor: The Pretender Mairsil ordered a great Calendar drawn up to show when the paths to the Dark Lands were strongest.

rulings.text: Does not change the mana cost of the spell, it just reduces what you pay for it.
You may choose not to apply Stone Calendar's cost reduction effect.

cards.name: Sunken City
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sunken City unless you pay {U}{U}.

Blue creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText:
All blue creatures gain +1/+1.

If you do not pay {U}{U} during your upkeep, Sunken City is destroyed.

cards.name: Tangle Kelp
cards.text:
Enchant creature

When Tangle Kelp enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.

Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step if it attacked during its controller's last turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature does not untap during its controller's untap phase if it attacked during its controller's last turn. Target creature becomes tapped when Tangle Kelp is cast.

cards.name: The Fallen
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, The Fallen deals 1 damage to each opponent it has dealt damage to this game.
cards.originalText: During its controller's upkeep, The Fallen does 1 damage to each opponent it has previously damaged.
cards.flavor: Magic often masters those who cannot master it.

rulings.text: It stops damaging players and forgets which players it damaged when it leaves the battlefield.
If The Fallen phases out and back in, it remembers which players it has dealt damage to this game.

The Fallen's ability causes it to deal damage only to opponents of its current controller. If The Fallen has dealt damage to you, and then you gain control of it, you won't be damaged during your upkeep.
The effect isn't cumulative. When it resolves, The Fallen deals 1 damage to each opponent previously dealt damage by it, regardless of how many times The Fallen dealt damage to that opponent before.

cards.name: Tivadar's Crusade
cards.text: Destroy all Goblins.
cards.originalText: All Goblins are destroyed.

cards.name: Tormod's Crypt
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt to remove all cards in target player's graveyard from the game.
cards.flavor: The dark opening seemed to breathe the cold, damp air of the dead earth in a steady rhythm.

cards.name: Tower of Coireall
cards.text: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked by Walls this turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature cannot be blocked by walls until end of turn.

cards.name: Tracker
cards.text: {G}{G}, {T}: Tracker deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tracker.
cards.originalText: {G}{G}, {T}: Tracker does an amount of damage equal to its power to target creature. Target creature does an amount of damage equal to its power to Tracker.

rulings.text: Giving either creature first strike does not affect the ability.

If this leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature. On the other hand, if the targeted creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability will be countered and no damage will be dealt.
You may have Tracker target itself with its own ability. If you do, Tracker will deal damage to itself equal to its power, then immediately do it again.

cards.name: Uncle Istvan
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Uncle Istvan by creatures.
cards.originalText: All damage done to Uncle Istvan by creatures is reduced to 0.
cards.flavor: Solitude drove the old hermit insane. Now he only keeps company with those he can catch.

rulings.text: Works even on damage from activated abilities of creatures such as Prodigal Sorcerer.

foreignNames.name: イシュトヴァーンおじ

cards.name: Venom
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
cards.originalText: All non-wall creatures target creature blocks or is blocked by are destroyed at the end of combat.
cards.flavor: "I told him it was just a flesh wound, a wee scratch, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If this Aura is moved onto a creature after blockers are declared, creatures blocking the newly-enchanted creature are not affected. This is because the ability triggers at the time blocking occurs.

cards.name: Wand of Ith
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player reveals a card at random from his or her hand. If it's a land card, that player discards it unless he or she pays 1 life. If it isn't a land card, the player discards it unless he or she pays life equal to its converted mana cost. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Look at one card at random from target player's hand. If the card is not a land, target player must choose either to discard it or pay an amount of life equal to its casting cost. If the card is a land, target player must choose either to discard it or pay 1 life. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life. Can only be used during controller's turn.

rulings.text: Any X in the mana cost of a card is zero for purposes of the Wand.

cards.name: War Barge
cards.text: {3}: Target creature gains islandwalk until end of turn. When War Barge leaves the battlefield this turn, destroy that creature. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: {3}: Target creature gains islandwalk until end of turn. If War Barge leaves play this turn, target creature is buried.

cards.name: Water Wurm
cards.text: Water Wurm gets +0/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.
cards.originalText: Water Wurm gains +0/+1 if opponent controls at least one island.

rulings.text: Only gets the bonus once even if more than one opponent has an Island on the battlefield.

cards.name: Whippoorwill
cards.text: {G}{G}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn. Damage that would be dealt to that creature this turn can't be prevented or dealt instead to another creature or player. When the creature dies this turn, exile the creature.
cards.originalText: {G}{G}, {T}: Until end of turn, target creature may not regenerate and damage done to target creature may not be prevented or redirected. If target creature goes to the graveyard, remove it from game.
cards.flavor: If the Whippoorwill remains silent, the soul has not reached its reward.

cards.name: Witch Hunter
cards.text:
{T}: Witch Hunter deals 1 damage to target player.

{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Witch Hunter does 1 damage to target player.

{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Return target creature opponent controls from play to owner's hand. Enchantments on target creature are destroyed.

cards.name: Word of Binding
cards.text: Tap X target creatures.
cards.originalText: X target creatures become tapped.
cards.flavor: "That was the worst experience of my days, standing there helpless as they killed my whole troop."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

cards.name: Worms of the Earth
cards.text:
Players can't play lands.

Lands can't enter the battlefield.

At the beginning of each upkeep, any player may sacrifice two lands or have Worms of the Earth deal 5 damage to him or her. If a player does either, destroy Worms of the Earth.
cards.originalText: No new land may be brought into play. During any player's upkeep, any player may destroy Worms of the Earth by sacrificing two lands or taking 5 damage from Worms of the Earth.
cards.flavor: The ground collapsed, leaving nothing but the great Worms' mucous residues.

rulings.text: Land can't enter the battlefield, so an effect that "puts a land onto the battlefield" won't do anything, and the land will stay where it is.

If you cast a spell or activate an ability that lets you put a land onto the battlefield, the effect fails. You'll still do everything else the spell or ability tells you to do, such as shuffle the library.
In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

If a permanent spell tries to enter the battlefield as a land during its resolution (for instance, a Clone entering the battlefield as a copy of a Dryad Arbor or an animated Mutavault), it is put into its owner's graveyard instead of entering the battlefield. It never enters the battlefield, so abilities that would have triggered on it entering the battlefield won't trigger.

cards.name: Wormwood Treefolk
cards.text:
{G}{G}: Wormwood Treefolk gains forestwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you.

{B}{B}: Wormwood Treefolk gains swampwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
{G}{G} Wormwood Treefolk gains forestwalk until end of turn and does 2 damage to you.

{B}{B} Wormwood Treefolk gains swampwalk until end of turn and does 2 damage to you.

rulings.text: Causing Wormwood Treefolk to gain forestwalk or swampwalk is useful only during the declare attackers step or earlier. Once it becomes blocked, giving it a landwalk ability won't change that.
